intro: Sisymbrium granatense, commonly known as the Granada mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and features small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant produces slender, cylindrical pods that contain small, rounded seeds. Sisymbrium granatense is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
